warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Perform squats with a controlled motion, focusing on depth and form. Complete 2 sets of 10 reps over 2 minutes.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand next to a wall for support.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and backward, then side to side. Complete 1 set of 10 swings per leg over 2 minutes.
Rotate hips in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise. Complete 1 set of 10 circles each direction over 2 minutes.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Stand under the barbell, positioning it on your upper traps.
2. Grip the bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Unrack the bar and step back, setting your feet shoulder-width apart.
4. Keep your chest up and core engaged.
5. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
6. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
7. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable posture and controlled movement throughout the squat.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips.
execution: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench.
2. Roll the barbell over your hips.
3. Plant your feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.
4. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
5. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
6. Lower your hips back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercises: American Hip Thrust, Banded Hip Thrust
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes and avoid overarching your back.

exercises.setup: Start with the bar on the ground. Pick it up like a regular deadlift for the first rep.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your chest up and shoulders back.
3. Push your hips back while keeping your knees slightly bent.
4. Lower the barbell along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Keep your back straight and core engaged.
6. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining tension in your hamstrings throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Position one foot on a bench behind you.
execution: 1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench.
2. Place one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending your front knee.
5. Descend until your front thigh is parallel to the ground.
6. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Use bodyweight or light dumbbells to maintain balance and control.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on balance and control, and ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes.

exercises.setup: Use a barbell, similar to a conventional deadlift setup.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your hips high and knees slightly bent.
3. Hinge at the hips to lower the barbell along your legs.
4. Maintain a straight back and engaged core.
5. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
6. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
exercises.weight: Start with a light to moderate weight to ensure proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Avoid rounding your back and focus on the hip hinge movement.
